history.proof: intros H. intro H1. qsimpl time: 1 use: divides_mult. qsimpl time: 1 use: divides_mult. unfold divides in H1. qsimpl time: 1 use: divides_mult. qsimpl time: 1 use: divides_mult. unfold divides in H1. qsimpl time: 1 use: divides_mult. rewrite Nat.divide_add_cancel_r. qsimpl time: 1 use: divides_mult,divides_le. qsimpl time: 1 use: divides_mult,divides_le. qsimpl time: 1 use: divides,divides_mult,divides_le. qsimpl time: 1 use: divides,divides_mult,divides_le. qauto use: Nat.divide_factor_r, Nat.add_comm, Nat.divide_add_r, Nat.mul_divide_cancel_l.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
q: nat
p: nat
k: nat

Goal:
k <> 0 -> k * p div k * q -> p div q

Premises:
divides_mult : forall p q k : nat, p div q -> p div k * q
divides_mult_r : forall p q k : nat, p div q -> p div q * k
divides_le : forall p q : nat, q <> 0 -> p div q -> p <= q
divides = fun n k : nat => exists p : nat, k = p * n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments divides (_ _)%nat_scope
divides_plus : forall p q1 q2 : nat, p div q1 -> p div q2 -> p div q1 + q2
divides_minus : forall p q1 q2 : nat, p div q1 -> p div q2 -> p div q1 - q2
divides_plus_inv : forall p q1 q2 : nat, p div q1 -> p div q1 + q2 -> p div q2
Nat.divide_mul_split : forall n m p : nat, n <> 0 -> Nat.divide n (m * p) -> exists q r : nat, n = q * r /\ Nat.divide q m /\ Nat.divide r p
mult_is_one : forall p q : nat, p * q = 1 -> p = 1 /\ q = 1
Init.Nat.sub = fix sub (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => n | S k => match m with | 0 => n | S l => sub k l end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.sub (_ _)%nat_scope
Pnat.Pos2Nat.inj : forall p q : BinNums.positive, BinPos.Pos.to_nat p = BinPos.Pos.to_nat q -> p = q
divides_0_inv : forall p : nat, 0 div p -> p = 0
divides_1_inv : forall p : nat, p div 1 -> p = 1
Nat.div_lt_upper_bound : forall a b q : nat, b <> 0 -> a < b * q -> a / b < q
Nat.div_unique_exact : forall a b q : nat, b <> 0 -> a = b * q -> q = a / b
Nat.div_le_upper_bound : forall a b q : nat, b <> 0 -> a <= b * q -> a / b <= q
Nat.div_le_lower_bound : forall a b q : nat, b <> 0 -> b * q <= a -> q <= a / b
divides_2_inv : forall p : nat, p div 2 -> p = 1 \/ p = 2
Pnat.Pos2Nat.inj_mul : forall p q : BinNums.positive, BinPos.Pos.to_nat (BinPos.Pos.mul p q) = BinPos.Pos.to_nat p * BinPos.Pos.to_nat q
divides_mult_compat : forall a b c d : nat, a div b -> c div d -> a * c div b * d
divides_0 : forall p : nat, p div 0
divides_trans : forall x y z : nat, x div y -> y div z -> x div z
divides_1 : forall p : nat, 1 div p
Nat.div_unique : forall a b q r : nat, r < b -> a = b * q + r -> q = a / b
divides_anti : forall x y : nat, x div y -> y div x -> x = y
Nat.mul_cancel_l : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0 -> p * n = p * m < -> n = m
Nat.mul_cancel_r : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0 -> n * p = m * p < -> n = m
Nat.mod_unique : forall a b q r : nat, r < b -> a = b * q + r -> r = a mod b
BinNatDef.N.eqb = fun n m : BinNums.N => match n with | BinNums.N0 => match m with | BinNums.N0 => true | BinNums.Npos _ => false end | BinNums.Npos p => match m with | BinNums.N0 => false | BinNums.Npos q => BinPos.Pos.eqb p q end end : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> bool Arguments BinNatDef.N.eqb (_ _)%N_scope
Nat.mul_divide_cancel_l : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0 -> Nat.divide (p * n) (p * m) < -> Nat.divide n m

```coq
intros H.
intro H1.
apply divides_mult in H1.
destruct H1 as [p H1].
rewrite <- Nat.divide_mul_split in H1.
unfold divides in H1.
destruct H1 as [q [H1 _]].
rewrite <- Nat.divide_mul_split in H1.
unfold divides in H1.
destruct H1 as [r [H1 _]].
rewrite H1.
apply divides_le in H1.
rewrite Nat.divide_mul_split in H1.
unfold divides in H1.
destruct H1 as [s [H1 _]].
rewrite <- Nat.divide_mul_split in H1.
unfold divides in H1.
destruct H1 as [t [H1 _]].
rewrite H1.
apply divides_mult in H1.
destruct H1 as [u H1].
rewrite <- Nat.divide_mul_split in H1.
unfold divides in H1.
destruct H1 as [v [H1 _]].
rewrite H1.
apply divides_le in H1.
rewrite Nat.divide_mul_split in H1.
unfold divides in H1.
destruct H1 as [w [H1 _]].
rewrite H1.
apply divides_trans with q.
apply divides_mult.
apply divides_trans with q.
apply divides_mult.
apply divides_trans with p.
apply divides_mult.
apply divides_trans with p.
apply divides_mult.
apply divides_le.
apply divides_mult.
Qed.```

original: intros H. intro H1. apply divides_mult in H1. destruct H1 as [p H1]. rewrite <- Nat.divide_mul_split in H1. unfold divides in H1. destruct H1 as [q [H1 _]]. rewrite <- Nat.divide_mul_split in H1. unfold divides in H1. destruct H1 as [r [H1 _]]. rewrite H1. apply divides_le in H1. rewrite Nat.divide_mul_split in H1. unfold divides in H1. destruct H1 as [s [H1 _]]. rewrite <- Nat.divide_mul_split in H1. unfold divides in H1. destruct H1 as [t [H1 _]]. rewrite H1. apply divides_mult in H1. destruct H1 as [u H1]. rewrite <- Nat.divide_mul_split in H1. unfold divides in H1. destruct H1 as [v [H1 _]]. rewrite H1. apply divides_le in H1. rewrite Nat.divide_mul_split in H1. unfold divides in H1. destruct H1 as [w [H1 _]]. rewrite H1. apply divides_trans with q. apply divides_mult. apply divides_trans with q. apply divides_mult. apply divides_trans with p. apply divides_mult. apply divides_trans with p. apply divides_mult. apply divides_le. apply divides_mult.
